patterns: what is cutoff for the college

responses:
For MMCOE, Pune UG admissions candidates must have passed class 12th with at least 50% marks from a recognised board also valid score in JEE Main, MHT CET conducted by NTA and State Common Entrance Test Cell - Maharashtra State respectively.
Here are the individual cutoff list of each branch :
BE Mechcanical - 53.82
BE Electrical - 58.71
BE ENTC -93.89
BE IT - 96.45
BE Computer - 97.18
BE AIDS - 95.56

patterns: what are the steps of admission process
responses:
Following are the steps for admission procedure :
Step 1 - registration of student(FMCIII Entrance)
Step 2 - seat acceptance confirmation & admission form filling through ERP portal(MB205)
Step 3 - scrutiny & verification of documents(MB207)
Step 4 - fee payment through ERP portal(MB207)
Step 5 - online admission confirmation(MB207)
Step 6 - submission of documents(MB207)
Step 7 - allotment of CPRN(MB207)
Step 8 - I-card & welcome kit collection(MB207)
Step 9 - hostel accommodation for girls/boys(if required)(MB207)
Step 10 - join branchwise whatsapp group

patterns: What is the difference between symmetric and asymmetric encryption?
responses:
Symmetric encryption uses the same key for encryption and decryption, while asymmetric encryption uses a pair of keys.
Symmetric encryption is faster, but asymmetric encryption provides better security.
Asymmetric encryption is used for key exchange, while symmetric encryption is used for data encryption.

patterns: What is the time complexity of bubble sort?
responses:
The time complexity of bubble sort is O(n^2) in the worst case.
Bubble sort has a time complexity of O(n) in the best case, but it's generally considered inefficient for large datasets.
Bubble sort's time complexity is quadratic, making it less suitable for large-scale applications.

patterns: How do I sort an ArrayList in Java?
responses:
Use the Collections.sort() method to sort an ArrayList.
You can also use the Arrays.sort() method if you have an array.
Don't forget to import java.util.Collections!

patterns: What is the difference between == and.equals() in Java?
responses:
The == operator checks for reference equality, while.equals() checks for value equality.
Use == for primitive types and.equals() for objects.
Remember, == is not the same as.equals()!

patterns: What is the difference between interface and abstract class in Java?
When to use interface vs abstract class
responses:
An interface defines a contract, while an abstract class provides a partial implementation.
Use an interface when you want to define a contract, and an abstract class when you want to provide a base implementation.
Remember, an interface can't have state, but an abstract class can!

patterns: What can I expect in a session with a mentor?
How long does a typical mentor session last?
responses: Mentor sessions typically last 45 minutes to 1 hour and are conducted online. In each session, you can discuss your questions, get guidance, and set goals with your mentor.

patterns: Is there a way to rate my mentor?
Can I leave feedback for my mentor?
How can I view feedback from other mentees about a mentor?
responses: Yes, after each session, you’ll have an option to rate your mentor and leave feedback. You can view mentor feedback on their profile page.

patterns: Can I reschedule my mentor session?
What are the available time slots for mentor sessions?
How do I cancel a mentor booking?
responses: To reschedule or cancel a mentor session, please go to your bookings page and select the session you’d like to modify.
Available time slots depend on the mentor’s availability. Let me know if you need help finding specific time slots.

patterns: How do I create an account to book a mentor?
How do I log into my Mentor Connect account?
Can I view my past sessions?
responses: To create an account, click on 'Sign Up' and fill in your details. Once your account is set up, you can book mentors and view your session history.
To view past sessions, log into your account and check the 'My Sessions' section.
